feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 1:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Including the following county, Anchorage. This includes the cities of Anchorage, Eagle River, Indian, And Eklutna. * WHEN...From late Friday night through late Sunday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..High water on the Tanana River into the Weekend... The Tanana River will continue to run near bankfull to bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to fall slowly over the next few days, but additional heavy rain moving into the central and eastern Interior, and Alaska Range, later today and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain in the Alaska Range this Weekend... A weather system moving across the state will bring 0.75 to 1.50 inches of rain to the Alaska Range this weekend. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali National Park, and south of Donnelly Dome in the Eastern Alaska Range.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL EVENT ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY... Widespread rain is expected across Southcentral Alaska through the weekend as a series of storm systems move across the region. Rain will overspread Southcentral from west to east through the day on Friday. Rain is expected to intensify across the Anchorage
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: High Surf Warning issued July 15 at 7:22AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Warning remains in effect... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 15 feet, with surfs up to 20 feet, will impact west, south and east facing shores exposed to the large southerly swells and strong tradewinds. * WHERE...All Islands of American Samoa.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued July 15 at 3:00AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Wind Advisory remains in effect.... * ...Trade winds up to 35 mph with higher gusts are expected to continue to impact the islands tonight... * TIMING...through Saturday. * IMPACTS...Expect possible downed tree limbs as well as shifting of loose and unsecured small objects due to strong winds. Gusty
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:21PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Navajo and Coconino Counties along I-40 near Winslow through 400 PM MDT/300 PM MST/... At 319 PM MDT/219 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meteor Crater to 10 miles west of Joseph City. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and blowing dust.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 15 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH SUNDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Sunday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 15 at 2:09PM PDT until July 16 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty winds with low RH expected Saturday and Sunday... .An upper level trough will approach the region Saturday then pass to our north on Sunday. This will produce increased winds Saturday and Sunday afternoons, that when combined with very low relative humidities, will likely result in critical fire weather conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:46AM PDT until July 16 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, have impacted the coast and bayshore this past week. Though the peek was Thursday morning localized flooding of specific low lying areas is still possible early Saturday morning
